author: The Canadian Press
title: 2-year-old son of B.C.’s David Foster wows with drumming talents in viral video - Red Deer Advocate
text: The two-year-old son of famed Canadian producer David Foster and singer Katharine McPhee is lighting up the internet with his musical talents. In a video posted to TikTok by McPhee and Instagram by Foster, the pair’s son is seen playing an impressive drum solo alongside a recording of Michael Jackson’s song “Rock with You.” Foster is seen in the video seated watching his son, bopping his head along to the beat while the two-year-old rocks out on a mini drum set complete with his name, Rennie Foster, splashed across the bass drum. McPhee’s video included the caption “my 2 year old baby is a genius.” Foster, the 74-year-old musician and composer, is a 16-time Grammy winner who was born in Victoria. He married McPhee, a 39-year-old singer and actress who was the runner-up in the 2006 season of American Idol, in 2019. Celebrities like Kristin Chenoweth, Questlove, Nicole Sherzinger, Joey McIntyre, Sharon Stone, Debra Messing, Charlie Puth and others took to the video comments to hype up the young drummer. READ ALSO: [Celine Song, Ryan Gosling, Martin Short among Canadians up for Golden Globes](https://www.todayinbc.com/entertainment/celine-song-ryan-gosling-martin-short-among-canadians-up-for-golden-globes-7293585) The Canadian Press

author: @WAFB
title: “That’s enough to wipe out everybody here,” said LPSO about their largest fentanyl bust
text:
“That’s enough to wipe out everybody here,” said LPSO about their largest fentanyl bust
LIVINGSTON, La. (WAFB) - Another record drug bust in Livingston Parish was reported after 100,000 lethal doses of fentanyl were seized by the sheriff’s office. It’s the largest fentanyl seizure in the parish’s history.
RELATED:[ 4 people arrested, over 100K lethal doses of Fentanyl seized during drug bust](https://www.wafb.com/2024/12/19/4-people-arrested-over-100k-lethal-doses-fentanyl-seized-during-drug-bust/)
”You have 150,000 population here, you have 100,000 pressed fentanyl pills, that’s enough to wipe out everybody here,” said Livingston Parish Sheriff Jason Ard.
Ard says Tyrone Broadway, Eugene ‘Jake’ Skinner, Donald ‘Bo’ McCray, and Devonte Skinner were arrested after an investigation that spanned over two years.
”It takes a while to do them because we want to do them right, we want to make sure these four individuals get a lot of time, I would like to see that they never come back into the streets again,” said Ard.
Ard believes these four alleged dealers are directly responsible for many of the overdoses in the parish.
”Overall, through this investigation, we have seized over 100,000 pills, several vehicles, oxycodone, fentanyl, and methamphetamines. These guys were serious problems there’s no doubt responsible for some of these overdoses that we’ve worked,” added Ard.
This was just one of several large fentanyl busts this year in the parish, which means their narcotics division has grown.
”Because of the narcotics and stuff we’ve been seeing because of our narcotics, we just added more agents to our narcotics so now we have more undercover narcotics and we did a couple of months ago,” explained Ard.
With their newly beefed up narcotics division, Ard says it’s only a matter of time before they get more drug dealers off the streets.
”That just means we will be able to do more than what we were doing so I’m very excited about 2025 and if I was a drug dealer, I probably wouldn’t be excited about 2025,” said Ard, If you’re out here and you think slinging dope is cool, It’s going to be cool until you see us and you will see us eventually cause we’ll put you in jail.”
Devonte Skinner, one of the four arrested, was also arrested back in April for another large fentanyl seizure in Livingston Parish. He was already in custody from that previous bust.
[Click here](mailto:typo@wafb.com) to report a typo. Please include the headline.
[Click here](https://www.wafb.com/newsletter/) to subscribe to our WAFB 9 News daily digest and breaking news alerts delivered straight to your email inbox.

author: Cora Hall
title: Tamari Key logs six blocks in Lady Vols' comeback win against Kentucky
text: Lady Vols overcome 17-point deficit to crush Kentucky behind Tamari Key's six blocks [Cora Hall](https://www.knoxnews.com/staff/8318348002/cora-hall/) [Tamari Key](/story/sports/college/university-of-tennessee/womens-basketball/2024/01/03/lady-vols-basketball-kellie-harper-tamari-key-best-game-of-season/72087161007/) smiled as she gave Tess Darby a high-five. Darby had just drained a 3-pointer to tie the game in the third quarter against Kentucky on Sunday, but Tennessee's 11-0 run was fueled with back-to-back blocks from Key. The second block from the senior center shut down Kentucky's Ajae Petty, who seemed unstoppable in a dominant first half for the Wildcats. The run gave [Lady Vols basketball](https://www.knoxnews.com/sports/womens-basketball/) all the momentum against Kentucky, erasing a 17-point first-half deficit to crush the Wildcats 87-69 at Thompson-Boling Arena at Food City Center. Key finished with a season-high six blocks and added two points and two rebounds. Tennessee trailed 49-39 at halftime and outscored Kentucky 48-20 in the second half. Senior forward Rickea Jackson had a game-high 27 points against Kentucky (8-8, 1-1) and went 11-for-18 shooting. She added seven rebounds, three assists and a steal. Tennessee (9-5, 2-0- SEC) is 5-1 with Jackson in the lineup this season and has won five straight. Tennessee struggles on defense, boards in first half Kentucky guard Eniya Russell, who was 3-for-14 from 3-point range entering Sunday, drained a 3-pointer three minutes before halftime to give the Wildcats a 17-point lead. Kentucky shot 5-for-8 from behind the arc in the first half, many of them wide open. UK went 3-for-3 from 3-point range to start the second quarter, forcing Tennessee coach Kellie Harper into an early timeout. Kentucky outscored Tennessee 31-25 in a offense-heavy second quarter. Both teams shot 50% in the first half. The Lady Vols also allowed eight offensive rebounds in the first half. They were outrebounded 20-18 in the half struggled to keep Petty off the boards. CHASING HISTORY: [Tennessee's Rickea Jackson on (early) pace for epic feat only one Lady Vols player has done](/story/sports/college/university-of-tennessee/womens-basketball/2024/01/06/rickea-jackson-lady-vols-basketball-average-double-double-program-history-rebounding/72116920007/) Turnovers an issue again for Lady Vols in first half Tennessee didn't see much improvement in the first half against Kentucky after 23 turnovers at Auburn in its SEC opener. It had seven in the first quarter, three of them by point guard Jasmine Powell. The Lady Vols had 10 turnovers by halftime. Jackson had five by halftime, two resulting from a travel violation and a charge. Tennessee got its turnovers under control in the second half and ended with 16. Jewel Spear turns momentum for Tennessee Senior guard Jewel Spear was a bright spot as Tennessee struggled in the first half. The senior guard had one of her best games since the beginning of the season, turning momentum toward the Lady Vols in the second quarter. Spear had 11 points in the second, going 3-for-3 from the field and 4-for-4 from the free-throw line. Her 3-pointer cut the lead to 10 points near the end of the quarter, and her poise was crucial for Tennessee. Spear finished with 21 points on 66.7% shooting along with six rebounds, two assists and two steals. [Cora Hall](https://www.knoxnews.com/staff/8318348002/cora-hall/) covers University of Tennessee women’s athletics. Email her at cora.hall@knoxnews.com and follow her on Twitter [@corahalll](https://twitter.com/corahalll). If you enjoy Cora’s coverage, [consider a digital subscription](https://cm.knoxnews.com/specialoffer/?gps-source=CPNEWS&utm) that allows you to access all of it.

author: PTI
title: Kamala Harris: US President Biden says VP Kamala Harris is 'qualified to be president' - The Economic Times
text: US President Joe Biden on Thursday said his deputy, Vice President Kamala Harris, is qualified to lead the county. At a press conference here, Biden said, From the very beginning, I made no bones about that. She is qualified to be the president. That's why I picked her. When asked about the reasons for this, he said Firstly because of the way she's handled the issue of freedom of women's bodies, to have control of their bodies and secondly, her ability to handle almost any issue on the board. This was a hell of a prosecutor. She was a first rate person and in the Senate, she was really good. I wouldn't have picked her unless I thought she was qualified to be the president, Biden said. The president mistakenly referred to Kamala Harris as Donald Trump during the press conference. He said, I wouldn't have picked Trump to be the vice president, did I think she was not qualified to be president.... The fact is that the consideration is that I think I'm the most qualified person to run for president. I beat him once and I will beat him again, Biden said. The idea that senators and congressmen are running for office worrying about the ticket is not unusual. And I might add, there were at least five presidents running or incumbent presidents who had lower numbers than I have now later in a campaign, he said. So, there's a long way to go in this campaign and so I'm just going to keep moving, he said.

author: VNExplorer
title: Met Office shares update on 'Beast from the East' bringing snow to UK in New Year
text:
The New Year is on the horizon and more freezing cold weather and snow could be on the way as we head into 2024, forecasters have warned.
The Met Office has delivered its verdict on another possible ‘Beast from the East’ hitting the UK, like the one we saw tear through the country back in 2018.
This chaotic weather event which brought hugely disruptive snowfall was caused by a Sudden Stratospheric Warming (SSW) – and it’s feared that these conditions could be repeated as we head into 2024.
The Mirror reports that a SSW occurs when stratospheric winds change direction and blow from east to west. They can also slow down, or stop entirely.
This triggers warming in the stratosphere, opening the pathway for easterly winds to move southwards which can weaken the jet stream. And occasionally, these winds can be accompanied by a cold air mass, causing the temperatures to drop dramatically.
Woman walking through heavy snow
The Met Office has said that colder spells in January are likely, but have downplayed any certainty of a SSW as it may be too soon to tell for certain.
They said: “Currently the chance of widespread severe cold is still deemed low, but still the risk of impacts from cold, ice and snow is greater than normal.”
Speaking to Sky News, Met Office spokesperson Stephen Dixon added: “It’s too early to tell if there will be a SSW event at the moment. Forecast models suggest a much weakened polar vortex over the coming weeks, but it’s not clear if this will result in an SSW or exactly how this will influence the UK’s weather patterns at this range.”
This comes after Storm Gerrit wreaked havoc on much of the UK this week, causing severe power cuts and leaving thousands of people stranded on the roads due to snow and flooding.
It’s estimated that around 1,500 homes in Scotland faced a second night without power as Scottish and Southern Electricity Networks said they had restored power to as many as 46,000 properties who had lost power due to the storm.
Shetland was one of the worst affected areas, as well as the north east of England. Operations director Andy Smith said: “This has been a difficult couple of days for the communities affected and I’m grateful to them for their patience and support as our teams work extremely hard to restore power.”
A supercell thunderstorm also moved across the northwest of England on Thursday after a similar storm is thought to have resulted in a tornado that damaged homes in Greater Manchester on Wednesday.
And three men tragically lost their lives after their vehicle was submerged in the River Esk on Thursday, North Yorkshire Police said.
Don’t miss the latest news from around Scotland and beyond. Sign up to our daily newsletter .

author: @indianexpress
title: Sagittarius Horoscope Today, 30-August-2024: Your children are a matter of concern and worry for you
text: Sagittarius Horoscope Prediction Today, 30-August-2024: It's a day to practice caution, says Ganesha. You are temperamental, irritable and restless today and this is likely to work against you. Avoid taking important decisions and beginning new tasks today. Your efforts may not reflect in your work, and this may displease your seniors. Be watchful about your detractors and competitors. Your children are a matter of concern and worry for you. In short, an average day for you today. Astrology Predictions: Sagittarius Love Horoscope Today You will spend an intimate time with your partner, nuzzling, and cuddle without a care in the world. Loving, caring and being truthful with your partner makes you the most demanded lover on the earth, feels Ganesha. You will create a soothing magic in the heart of your loved one. Astrology Predictions: Sagittarius Finance Horoscope Today Later in the day, Ganesha foresees that you will be balanced about your financial situation. Income or expenses will both receive equal consideration on your part. Weekly Horoscope, 26-August to 01-September-2024 Astrology Predictions: Sagittarius Career Horoscope Today Nothing will go wrong as luck will shine brightly today. You will start your day with loads of energy. Not the energy drink, this is the result of your powerful planetary position, foresees Ganesha. Energetic time is ahead in the career front. author: sina.com.cn
title: 中欧内需成长混合C净值上涨5.36%|福耀玻璃_新浪财经_新浪网
text:
中欧内需成长混合型证券投资基金（简称：中欧内需成长混合C，代码010853）公布4月23日最新净值，上涨5.36%。
中欧内需成长混合C成立于2021年8月3日，业绩比较基准为 收益率×70%+中证港股通综合指数收益率×10%+银行活期存款利率(税后)×20%。该基金成立以来收益-30.85%，今年以来收益15.02%，近一月收益-5.03%，近一年收益35.61%，近三年收益-5.01%。近一年，该基金排名同类338/7823。
基金经理为钟鸣。钟鸣自2023年9月15日管理（或拟管理）该基金，任职期内收益24.91%。
最新定期报告显示，该基金前十大重仓股如下：

author: M3 Web - http://m3web.bg
title: COVID-19 In Bulgaria: 118 New Cases In The Last 24 Hours
text:
COVID-19 In Bulgaria: 118 New Cases In The Last 24 Hours
The new confirmed cases of coronavirus in Bulgaria for the last 24 hours are 118, according to the data of the Unified Information Portal.
868 tests were carried out, which means that the proportion of positive results is 13.6 percent.
Two patients with confirmed coronavirus infection have died.
To date, there are 325 people in hospitals with a diagnosis of COVID-19, of which 31 are in intensive care units. There are 11 new arrivals in medical facilities.
11 people have been cured in the last 24 hours, and a total of 1,289,822 since the beginning of the pandemic.
There are currently 4,963 active cases.
In the last 24 hours, not a single dose of a vaccine against COVID-19 has been administered. A total of 4,724,308 have been administered since the start of the immunization campaign.
A total of 38,668 people in the country have lost the battle with the coronavirus out of the confirmed 1,333,453 infected since the beginning of the pandemic, according to the data of the Unified Information Portal.
